skills.label: Identify deployment considerations
items: Describe the hardware and software requirements for microsoft dynamics crm
Explain the role of supporting technologies, including active directory, active directory federation services (adfs), microsoft sharepoint, microsoft exchange, and the secure token service
Identify supported browsers

skills.label: Plan an implementation
items: Identify the required active directory groups, identify the microsoft dynamics crm licensing model and license types, explain product key types and access mode types, plan multiple organizations, plan how to access microsoft dynamics crm

skills.label: Configure Microsoft Dynamics CRM Online
items: Install sample data, install and configure language packs, install the email router, configure server synchronization, configure sharepoint integration

skills.label: Plan a deployment
items: Identify options for accessing crm data
Describe licensing plans
Identify requirements
Customize microsoft dynamics crm online
Create user accounts
Manage subscriptions, licenses, and user accounts
Assign users to security roles

skills.label: Deploy Microsoft Dynamics CRM Online
items: Create a deployment plan, identify objects that you can customize, implement customizations, grant users access to microsoft dynamics crm online, compare microsoft online services administrative roles and microsoft dynamics crm online security roles, provision users and assign licenses

skills.label: Manage Microsoft Dynamics CRM Online instances
items: Compare multiple instances versus multiple tenants, describe reasons to implement multiple instances, add instances to a subscription, configure instances, copy instances, identify features and constraints of a multi-tenant deployment, create a sandbox organization, copy an organization

skills.label: Manage Microsoft Dynamics CRM Online
items: Prepare for updates
Import solutions
Manage email notifications
Configure microsoft dynamics crm to use exchange online, lync, sharepoint online, and yammer
Add storage
Free storage space

label: Upgrade a Microsoft Dynamics CRM edition and redeploy Microsoft Dynamics CRM (15–20%)

skills.label: Select an upgrade strategy
items: Describe upgrade paths, processes, and supported upgrade editions
Identify upgrade considerations

skills.label: Upgrade Microsoft Dynamics CRM and other components
items: Upgrade the email router, upgrade microsoft dynamics crm for microsoft outlook, import and update organization

skills.label: Configure email and message processing
items: Identify email process options
Explain the advantages and disadvantages of email processing options
Track email, appointments, tasks, and contacts
Configure automatic email tracking
Configure correlation
Monitor individual mailboxes
Identify available synchronization methods
Manage synchronization filters

skills.label: Install and configure the Microsoft Dynamics CRM Email Router
items: Identify supported email systems and windows operating systems
Install the email router
Install the rule deployment wizard
Create incoming and outgoing email profiles, deploy inbox rules and forwarding rules
Create and monitor a forward mailbox
Migrate email router settings

skills.label: Configure server-side synchronization
items: Describe the features of and identify supported configurations
Enable and configure server-side synchronization
Configure exchange online
Synchronize appointments, contacts, and tasks

label: Install and deploy other client tools for Microsoft Dynamics CRM (15–20%)

skills.label: Identify hardware and software requirements for the Microsoft Outlook client
items: Identify minimum hardware requirements, identify supported operating systems, identify supported outlook versions, identify supported internet browsers

skills.label: Install and upgrade the Microsoft Outlook client
items: Identify deployment methods, install the client, prepare a configuration file and install the client by using the command prompt

skills.label: Configure the Microsoft Outlook client
items: Use the configuration wizard for on-premises or hosted organizations, work online and offline, configure multiple organizations, configure user email settings, create and modify data synchronization filters

skills.label: Install and configure the client for tablets and phones
items: Identify supported mobile platforms, install the app, configure security permissions required to use the app, troubleshoot the app, capture trace logs

label: Manage and troubleshoot a Microsoft Dynamics CRM deployment (15–20%)

skills.label: Manage system jobs
items: Describe system job types, view and delete system jobs, limit the number of asynchronous jobs, delete records, use the bulk deletion wizard

skills.label: Monitor and troubleshoot Microsoft Dynamics CRM
items: Configure tracing for microsoft dynamics crm for microsoft outlook, discuss the microsoft dynamics marketplace

skills.label: Manage data encryption
items: Describe data encryption, identify attributes that support encryption, identify required privileges to manage encryption
